results.title: Choosing Your Marriage Partner
results.brief_description: A dramatised story of a young man who is trying to decide which of two young women would make the better wife!?! Several important factors in selecting a marriage partner are illustrated; emotional maturity, family background, harmony of personality, philosophy of life and common interests. Note: Made in 1952.

results.title: Caulfield: a Living City
results.creator_credit: John Freney-Mills, Ewart Wade, Caulfield City Council and Caulfield Film Society
results.brief_description:
Weekend activities in the City of Caulfield. Schools, churches, sporting and social service groups keep the city alive at weekends. Activities include the running of the Caulfield Cup, and quieter games such as tennis and bowls. School children learn road safety at special classes and attend the Youth Centre. For the elderly citizens there are “meals-on-wheels”.

(11/2/19 CC) Selected highlights list from MP:
00:00:02:00 Title card with Caulfield Town Hall in background
00:00:32:00 Caulfield train station
00:01:07:00 Caulfield Race Course on Caulfield Cup
00:01:54:00 Caulfield marching girls perform with Caulfield Citizen band
00:03:54:00 Packer Reserve Bike Track with St Johns Ambulance attendees
00:04:35:00 Caulfield Park Bowling Club with men playing bowls and women playing croquet at 00:04:56:00
00:05:20:00 Caulfield Central RSL
00:05:50:00 cricket game on H.G Ritchie Oval
00:06:12:00 15th Caulfield Somers Country scouts packing glass bottles into a 1950’s Holden Ute
00:06:40:00 model aeroplane flying with Caulfield Technical College - now Monash University (Caulfield campus) in background
00:07:02:00 City of Caulfield Memorial Youth Centre with basketball being played and wrestling with up and coming star Don Fitzpatrick
00:08:00:00 Women sewing at the Caulfield Memorial Youth Centre
00:08:38:00 Curraweena homes near Caulfield community hall
00:09:55:00 Salvation Army marches past Salvation Army building
00:10:20:00 Church service at St Catharine South Caulfield, 402 Kooyong Rd
00:11:07:00 Salvation Army band play at Nooralie Private Hospital
00:12:24:00 what appears to be St Aloysius Church with spire
00:12:44:00 Caulfield Park Conservatory and gardens
00:14:00:00 garbage collection from house and people leaving for work
00:14:52:00 shot of Caulfield Technical College now Monash University (Caulfield campus) and students entering the front stair case
00:15:05:00 Kilyington Baptist Grammar School
00:15:30:00 Caulfield South Pre-school
00:15:52:00 Elsternwick train station
00:16:08:00 asphalt laying
00:16:28:00 Sir Henry Gullett Memorial Baby Health Centre
00:16:43:00 Elderly Citizen Club and meals service
00:18:27:00 Caulfield Town Hall inside and outside

results.title: The Car Stealers
results.creator_credit: Eric L. Morris, Geoffrey Thompson, Council of Fire and Accident Underwriters and Cine Services
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the problem of car theft and joy-riding by young teenagers in Australia. Points out to car owners and parents how their carelessness can be partly responsible. Shows safety devices and security checks for car-owners. Made with the co-operation of the Victorian Police.

results.title: Camberwell Junction
results.brief_description: Made by Ivan Gaal, this film is in three parts. Still photographs of ‘past…definite’ are accompanied by sounds of horses hooves. ‘Present…indicative’ shows speeded up traffic during the day and night, making it difficult for people to cross the roads. ‘Future…indefinite’ poses a question mark.

results.title: Born in the sun
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the development of the dried fruits industry at Mildura from the time of Deakin’s irrigation bill, and highlights the part irrigation has played. Includes a dramatised extract of an Alfred Deakin speech. The film shows climatic setbacks which the industry has experienced. Illustrates the harvesting, processing and distribution of the fruit.

results.title: Australia's wheat
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt, John Gray, Heinz Fenke, Lilias Castle, Stephen Carthew, AWB Limited and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Provides an outline of the Australian wheat industry, a brief history and general view of growing, harvesting, bulk handling and processing, research and marketing. Shows the industry from the historical beginnings at Experiment Farm and the growing colony of New South Wales, to mechanical innovation, nationwide research and modern transport and handling. Explains the farmer’s work through each season and traces the marketing of the grain from the country silo to the consumers overseas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kit Guyatt, John Gray, Heinz Fenke, Lilias Castle, Stephen Carthew, AWB Limited and Fraser Castle Productions

results.title: Australian gazette. No. 363
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Adelaide dog show; Bronzetti wins the Caulfield Cup against Chrome and Rael Loein; Rocket wins the Sydney Flying Squadron’s handicap in the opening event of the sailing season on Sydney Harbour and 85 unions are represented at the annual eight hour day demonstrations.

results.title: At the Land's End: the Wilson's Promontory National Park
results.creator_credit: David Swift, Wilson's Promontory Committee of Management, Parks Victoria and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film shows the breathtaking landscape, the wildlife and the facilities for holiday-makers at Tidal River. The work of the ranger is described and there are two outstanding sequences dealing with the Smoking Cliffs at Darby River and gannets diving off Five-Mile Beach. Narrated by Wynn Roberts.

results.title: Compression
results.brief_description: Ricky Morris is the 21st member of his family to see active service for Australia. He is proud to be part of the fighting Gunditjmarra people. His story looks at the invisible pressures modern soldiers constantly face and his realisation that this was shared by his family waiting for him at home.
results.description: Ricky Morris is the 21st member of his family to see active service for Australia. He is proud to be part of the fighting Gunditjmarra people. His story looks at the invisible pressures modern soldiers constantly face and his realisation that this was shared by his family waiting for him at home.

results.title: Back to being black
results.brief_description: John Lovett reflects on the injustices experienced by his father and so many other indigenous war veterans who were not recognised or afforded the same benefits as their white mates when they returned from service.
